Title: libgda: Format string vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Two format string vulnerabilities in libgda may lead to the execution of
    arbitrary code.

Background.Text: libgda is the library handling the data abstraction layer in the Gnome data access architecture (GNOME-DB). It can also be used by non-GNOME applications to manage data stored in databases or XML files.

Description.Text: Steve Kemp discovered two format string vulnerabilities in the gda_log_error and gda_log_message functions. Some applications may pass untrusted input to those functions and be vulnerable.

Impact.Text: An attacker could pass malicious input to an application making use of the vulnerable libgda functions, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of that application.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All libgda users should upgrade to the latest version:
